Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Vase
Description: Miniature tube-shaped vase with a flat circular bottom and a small foot, slightly flared at the bottom and also misshapen in areas. The body bulges near the bottom and narrows near the top. Crudely manufactured, there are accumulations of clay in areas. Forty-seven vessels of this type were found in the same foundation deposit.
